sentences.english: To his family, their guilt, to work, but no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 对家人，她们心存内疚，对工作，却无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Greate your destiny and then go out and live it with absolutely no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 创造你自己的命运，并无怨无悔地过好每一天。

sentences.english: The woman followed the men to suffer without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 而女人就无怨无悔地跟着男人受苦受难。

sentences.english: Fight a year in spring and summer, autumn and winter, cardiac life no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 拼一年春夏秋冬，搏一生无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Create your won life and live without any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 创造自己的生活，无怨无悔地生活。

sentences.english: Living each day with no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 每一天都过得无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Said Qiu Yuanyuan. As the wife of a soldier, she has no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 邱媛媛说，作为军人的妻子，她无怨无悔。

sentences.english: That gonna make your leavings without regret and willing to do so.
sentences.chinese: 更让你们走的无怨无悔，心甘情愿。

sentences.english: The hot sun, we sprinkle with sweat, has no doubts whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 炎炎烈日下，我们挥洒着汗水，却无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Spell a qiu dong chun xia, win the life with no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 拼一个秋冬春夏，赢一生无怨无悔。

sentences.english: One that pulls at the heart without remorse.
sentences.chinese: 无怨无悔地牵动着心儿的人啊。

sentences.english: Create your destiny and make every day happy with absolutely no regrets.
sentences.chinese: 创造你自己的命运，并无怨无悔的过好每一天。

sentences.english: The final proof lies in its ability to scale with shame and his career.
sentences.chinese: 最后的证明在于能够含垢忍辱，无怨无悔。

definition: honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
